CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper May 19, 1951, pg. 7, reads: "High School Artists From W. VA. - When Miss Elsie Mae Davis, far left, art instructor at Garnet High School, Charleston, W. Va., came to Pittsburgh last week where two of her students, Gordon Beverly and Samuel Chappelle, third from right and far right, respectively won honors, she brought students who took part in state scholastic art contests with her.  They were Sylvia Goodwin, Anna Board and Jo Ann Conner.  Chappelle took second prize in the national scholastic exhibit at Carnegie Museum, and Beverly got honorable mention. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Garnet High School teacher Elsie Mae Davis with students Sylvia Goodwin, Anna Board, Gordon Beverly, Jo Ann Conner, and Samuel Chappelle at Scholastic Art exhibit at Carnegie Museum
